header.title: Legacy ERP Migration
header.subtitle: A 12-month initiative to modernize core banking infrastructure, moving from an on-premise monolith to a scalable AWS microservices architecture.

problem.content: The existing 15-year-old ERP system was causing significant bottlenecks. Reporting took 48 hours to generate, data redundancy was high (approx. 40%), and maintenance costs were rising by 15% YoY. The system could not support the new mobile banking features planned for Q4.

solution.content: We designed a phased migration plan to a cloud-native architecture. I mapped out the AS-IS and TO-BE processes using BPMN, identified 12 core microservices, and established a data lake strategy for real-time reporting using Snowflake and AWS Glue.

deliverables.title: Documentation
deliverables.description: Authored 25+ detailed PRDs for engineering teams covering Authentication, Ledger, and Reporting modules.

deliverables.title: Visual Modeling
deliverables.description: Created comprehensive UML Diagrams (Sequence, Activity, ERD) to visualize data flow between microservices.

deliverables.title: Stakeholder Mgmt
deliverables.description: Facilitated weekly backlog grooming sessions and served as the primary liaison between business stakeholders and developers.

deliverables.title: Data Analysis
deliverables.description: Performed SQL gap analysis to map 5,000+ data fields from legacy schemas to the new Snowflake EDW.
